page.title: 02RETAIL TRADE IN WICKHAM MKT.
page.content: For a village, Wickham Market has quite a large number of shops attracting people from miles around. Food can be bought seven days a week throughout the year. Taylors is a small supermarket that sells frogslegs, snails and lots more. The Co-op & Finefare, also supermarkets sell everything from Sugar Puffs to rubbers. Mrs. Runnicles bakes her own bread, cakes, pies & pastries. She also sells sweets and flowers. Mr. Revett the butcher is famous for his steak and sausages. The Post Office has the largest sweets counter in the village. You can also get toys, cards and stationary there. Mr. Wilbey owns both paper shops and there three pubs although the White Hart Hotel has gone bankrupt. There is Seagers the hardware store, Abbotts & Cliffords being two estate agents, three antique shops, a wool shop, Deben Mill for
